docs.title: Pre-requisites
docs.text:
You will need to have the following installed:

  • Nix
  • Direnv

Important

We use a Flake-based workflow. You can certainly develop for nixos-facter without Flakes and leverage much of what is listed below, but it is left up to the reader to determine how to make that work.

docs.title: Go development
docs.text:
The default devshell is a modified version of the underlying Nix derivation for nixos-facter. As such, it provides all the necessary tooling and utilities for working on nixos-facter.

nix/devshells/default.nix
{
  perSystem,
  pkgs,
  ...
}:
perSystem.self.nixos-facter.overrideAttrs (old: {
  GOROOT = "${old.go}/share/go";
  nativeBuildInputs =
    old.nativeBuildInputs
    ++ [
      perSystem.gomod2nix.default
      pkgs.enumer
      pkgs.delve
      pkgs.pprof
      pkgs.gotools
      pkgs.golangci-lint
      pkgs.cobra-cli
      pkgs.fx # json tui
      perSystem.hwinfo.default
    ];
  shellHook = ''
    # this is only needed for hermetic builds
    unset GO_NO_VENDOR_CHECKS GOSUMDB GOPROXY GOFLAGS
  '';
})

Direnv should load this by default when entering the root of the repository.

For the most part, you should be able to develop normally as you would any other Go program.

Important

When you have completed making any changes and have tested it as you would any other Go program, it is important to ensure it works when run as a Nix package.

This can be done with nix run .# -- <args>, which will build the Nix derivation and execute the resultant nixos-facter binary.

docs.title: Formatting
docs.text:
We use treefmt and treefmt-nix to format the repository by running nix fmt from the root directory.

nix/formatter.nix
{
  pkgs,
  inputs,
  ...
}:
inputs.treefmt-nix.lib.mkWrapper pkgs {
  projectRootFile = ".git/config";

  programs = {
    alejandra.enable = true;
    deadnix.enable = true;
    gofumpt.enable = true;
    prettier.enable = true;
    statix.enable = true;
  };

  settings = {
    global.excludes = [
      "LICENSE"
      # unsupported extensions
      "*.{gif,png,svg,tape,mts,lock,mod,sum,toml,env,envrc,gitignore}"
    ];

    formatter = {
      deadnix = {
        priority = 1;
      };

      statix = {
        priority = 2;
      };

      alejandra = {
        priority = 3;
      };

      prettier = {
        options = [
          "--tab-width"
          "4"
        ];
        includes = ["*.{css,html,js,json,jsx,md,mdx,scss,ts,yaml}"];
      };
    };
  };
}

docs.title: Checks
docs.text: Running nix flake check will build all the devshells and Nix packages, as well as check the formatting with treefmt and any other Flake checks that have been configured.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
When making changes, it is important to add or update any relevant sections in the documentation within the same pull request.

For more information see the next section.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
There is a separate devshell called docs which is provided for working with the docs locally.

It can be entered by running: nix develop .#docs

nix/devshells/docs.nix
{
  pkgs,
  perSystem,
  ...
}:
pkgs.mkShellNoCC {
  packages = with pkgs;
  # Pop an empty shell on systems that aren't supported by godoc
    lib.optionals (perSystem.godoc ? default)
    ([
        perSystem.godoc.default
        (pkgs.writeScriptBin "gen-reference" ''
          out="./docs/content/reference/go_doc"
          godoc -c -o $out .
        '')
        (pkgs.writeScriptBin "mkdocs" ''
          # generate reference docs first
          gen-reference
          # execute the underlying command
          ${pkgs.mkdocs}/bin/mkdocs "$@"
        '')
      ]
      ++ (with pkgs.python3Packages; [
        mike
        mkdocs-material
      ]));
}

The docs are based on MkDocs and the MkDocs Material theme. You will find its configuration and content in the following locations:

  • mkdocs.yaml
  • ./docs

docs.title: Serve locally
docs.text:
To serve the docs locally run mkdocs serve from the root of the repository:

❯ mkdocs serve
INFO    -  Building documentation...
INFO    -  Cleaning site directory
WARNING -  The following pages exist in the docs directory, but are not included in the "nav" configuration:
             - index.md
INFO    -  Documentation built in 0.26 seconds
INFO    -  [16:22:36] Watching paths for changes: 'docs/content', 'mkdocs.yml'
INFO    -  [16:22:36] Serving on http://127.0.0.1:8000/nixos-facter/

docs.title: Versioning & Publication
docs.text:
Versioning of the docs is managed through mike.

It is responsible for managing the structure of the gh-pages branch in the repository, which Github Pages is configured to serve from.

Note

More information about versioning with MkDocs Material and mike can be found here.

There is a github workflow, .github/workflows/gh-pages.yml which is responsible for publishing the docs. It does the following:

  • On merge to main, the docs version main is updated.
  • When a new tag is created of the form v.<major>.<minor>.<patch> a docs version v<major>.<minor> is created and the latest alias is updated to point to this.

The idea is that users will land on the latest released version of the docs by default, with main being available if they wish to read about unreleased features and changes.

To preview the versions locally you can use mike serve instead of mkdocs serve.

Warning

Be sure to have fetched the latest changes for the gh-pages branch first. This is especially important if you are using mike locally to make manual changes to the published site.

docs.title: Generate a report
docs.text:
To generate a report, you will need to have Nix installed on the target machine.

sudo nix run \
  --option experimental-features "nix-command flakes" \
  --option extra-substituters https://numtide.cachix.org \
  --option extra-trusted-public-keys numtide.cachix.org-1:2ps1kLBUWjxIneOy1Ik6cQjb41X0iXVXeHigGmycPPE= \
  github:numtide/nixos-facter -- -o facter.json

Note

In the near-future we will add nixos-facter to nixpkgs. Until then, we recommend using the Numtide Binary Cache to avoid having to build everything from scratch.

This will scan your system and produce a JSON-based report in a file named facter.json:

facter.json
{
  "version": 2, // (1)!
  "system": "x86_64-linux", // (2)!
  "virtualisation": "none", // (3)!
  "hardware": { // (4)!
    "bios": { ... },
    "bluetooth": [ ... ],
    "bridge": [ ... ],
    "chip_card": [ ... ] ,
    "cpu": [ ... ],
    "disk": [ ... ],
    "graphics_card": [ ... ],
    "hub": [ ... ],
    "keyboard": [ ... ],
    "memory": [ ... ],
    "monitor": [ ... ],
    "mouse": [ ... ],
    "network_controller": [ ... ],
    "network_interface": [ ... ],
    "sound": [ ... ],
    "storage_controller": [ ... ],
    "system": [ ... ],
    "unknown": [ ... ],
    "usb_controller": [ ... ]
  },
  "smbios": { // (5)!
    "bios": { ... },
    "board": { ... },
    "cache": [ ... ],
    "chassis": { ... },
    "config": { ... },
    "language": { ... },
    "memory_array": [ ... ],
    "memory_array_mapped_address": [ ... ],
    "memory_device": [ ... ],
    "memory_device_mapped_address": [ ... ],
    "memory_error": [ ... ],
    "onboard": [ ... ],
    "port_connector": [ ... ],
    "processor": [ ... ],
    "slot": [ ... ],
    "system": { ... }
  }
}
  1. Used to track major breaking changes in the report format.
  2. Architecture of the target machine.
  3. Indicates whether the report was generated inside a virtualised environment, and if so, what type.
  4. All the various bits of hardware that could be detected.
  5. System Management BIOS information if available.

Tip

To use this report in your NixOS configuration, have a look at NixOS Facter Modules.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
Type is the type of swap e.g. partition or file.

Type JSON SwapType type

docs.title: Filename
docs.text:
Filename is the path to the swap device or file.

Type JSON string path

docs.title: Size
docs.text:
Size is the total size of the swap in kilobytes.

Type JSON uint64 size

docs.title: Used
docs.text:
Used is the amount of swap space currently in use, in kilobytes.

Type JSON uint64 used

docs.title: Priority
docs.text:
Priority determines the order in which swap spaces are used. Higher numbers have higher priority.

Type JSON int32 priority

docs.title: Hardware
docs.text: Hardware represents various hardware components and their details. The fields are in alphabetical order, and list types are sorted to ensure a consistent and stable report output.

docs.title: Bios
docs.text:
Bios holds the BIOS details of the hardware.

Type JSON *hwinfo.DetailBios bios,omitempty

docs.title: BlockDevice
docs.text:
BlockDevice holds the list of block devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice block_device,omitempty

docs.title: Bluetooth
docs.text:
Bluetooth holds the list of Bluetooth devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice bluetooth,omitempty

docs.title: Braille
docs.text:
Braille holds the list of Braille devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice braille,omitempty

docs.title: Bridge
docs.text:
Bridge holds the list of bridge devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice bridge,omitempty

docs.title: Camera
docs.text:
Camera holds the list of camera devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice camera,omitempty

docs.title: Cdrom
docs.text:
Cdrom holds the list of CD-ROM devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice cdrom,omitempty

docs.title: ChipCard
docs.text:
ChipCard holds the list of chip card devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice chip_card,omitempty

docs.title: Cpu
docs.text:
Cpu holds the list of CPU details in the hardware. There is one entry per physical id.

Type JSON []hwinfo.DetailCpu cpu,omitempty

docs.title: Disk
docs.text:
Disk holds the list of disk devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice disk,omitempty

docs.title: DslAdapter
docs.text:
DslAdapter holds the list of DSL adapter devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice dsl_adapter,omitempty

docs.title: DvbCard
docs.text:
DvbCard holds the list of DVB card devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice dvb_card,omitempty

docs.title: Fingerprint
docs.text:
Fingerprint holds the list of fingerprint devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice fingerprint,omitempty

docs.title: Firewire
docs.text:
Firewire holds the list of Firewire devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice firewire,omitempty

docs.title: FirewireController
docs.text:
FirewireController holds the list of Firewire controllers in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice firewire_controller,omitempty

docs.title: Floppy
docs.text:
Floppy holds the list of floppy disk devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice floppy,omitempty

docs.title: FrameBuffer
docs.text:
FrameBuffer holds the list of frame buffer devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice frame_buffer,omitempty

docs.title: GraphicsCard
docs.text:
GraphicsCard holds the list of graphics card devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice graphics_card,omitempty

docs.title: Hotplug
docs.text:
Hotplug holds the list of hotplug devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice hotplug,omitempty

docs.title: HotplugController
docs.text:
HotplugController holds the list of hotplug controllers in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice hotplug_controller,omitempty

docs.title: Hub
docs.text:
Hub holds the list of hub devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice hub,omitempty

docs.title: Ide
docs.text:
Ide holds the list of IDE devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice ide,omitempty

docs.title: Isapnp
docs.text:
Isapnp holds the list of ISAPNP devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice isapnp,omitempty

docs.title: IsdnAdapter
docs.text:
IsdnAdapter holds the list of ISDN adapter devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice isdn_adapter,omitempty

docs.title: Joystick
docs.text:
Joystick holds the list of joystick devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice joystick,omitempty

docs.title: Keyboard
docs.text:
Keyboard holds the list of keyboard devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice keyboard,omitempty

docs.title: Manual
docs.text:
Manual holds the list of manually configured devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice manual,omitempty

docs.title: Memory
docs.text:
Memory holds the list of memory devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice memory,omitempty

docs.title: MmcController
docs.text:
MmcController holds the list of MMC controller devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice mmc_controller,omitempty

docs.title: Modem
docs.text:
Modem holds the list of modem devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice modem,omitempty

docs.title: Monitor
docs.text:
Monitor holds the list of monitor devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice monitor,omitempty

docs.title: Mouse
docs.text:
Mouse holds the list of mouse devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice mouse,omitempty

docs.title: NetworkController
docs.text:
NetworkController holds the list of network controller devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice network_controller,omitempty

docs.title: NetworkInterface
docs.text:
NetworkInterface holds the list of network interface devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice network_interface,omitempty

docs.title: None
docs.text:
None holds the list of devices in the hardware with no specific class.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice none,omitempty

docs.title: Nvme
docs.text:
Nvme holds the list of NVMe devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice nvme,omitempty

docs.title: Partition
docs.text:
Partition holds the list of partition devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice partition,omitempty

docs.title: Pci

Pci holds the list of PCI devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice pci,omitempty

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice pcmcia,omitempty

docs.title: PcmciaController
docs.text:
PcmciaController holds the list of PCMCIA controllers in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice pcmcia_controller,omitempty

docs.title: Pppoe
docs.text:
Pppoe holds the list of PPPoE devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice pppoe,omitempty

docs.title: Printer
docs.text:
Printer holds the list of printer devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice printer,omitempty

docs.title: Redasd
docs.text:
Redasd holds the list of REDASD devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice redasd,omitempty

docs.title: Scanner
docs.text:
Scanner holds the list of scanner devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice scanner,omitempty

docs.title: Scsi
docs.text:
Scsi holds the list of SCSI devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice scsi,omitempty

docs.title: Sound
docs.text:
Sound holds the list of sound devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice sound,omitempty

docs.title: StorageController
docs.text:
StorageController holds the list of storage controller devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice storage_controller,omitempty

docs.title: System
docs.text:
System holds the system details of the hardware.

Type JSON *hwinfo.DetailSys system,omitempty

docs.title: Tape
docs.text:
Tape holds the list of tape devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice tape,omitempty

docs.title: TvCard
docs.text:
TvCard holds the list of TV card devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice tv_card,omitempty

docs.title: Unknown
docs.text:
Unknown holds the list of unknown devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice unknown,omitempty

docs.title: Usb
docs.text:
Usb holds the list of USB devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice usb,omitempty

docs.title: UsbController
docs.text:
UsbController holds the list of USB controller devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice usb_controller,omitempty

docs.title: VesaBios
docs.text:
VesaBios holds the list of VESA BIOS devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice vesa_bios,omitempty

docs.title: WlanCard
docs.text:
WlanCard holds the list of WLAN card devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice wlan_card,omitempty

docs.title: Zip
docs.text:
Zip holds the list of ZIP drive devices in the hardware.

Type JSON []hwinfo.HardwareDevice zip,omitempty

docs.title: Report
docs.text: Report represents a detailed report on the system’s hardware, virtualisation, SMBios, and swap entries.

docs.title: Version
docs.text:
Version is a monotonically increasing number, used to indicate breaking changes or new features in the report output.

Type JSON uint version

docs.title: System
docs.text:
System indicates the system architecture e.g. x86_64-linux.

Type JSON string system

docs.title: Virtualisation
docs.text:
Virtualisation indicates the type of virtualisation or container environment present on the system.

Type JSON virt.Type virtualisation

docs.title: Hardware
docs.text:
Hardware provides detailed information about the system’s hardware components, such as CPU, memory, and peripherals.

Type JSON Hardware hardware,omitempty

docs.title: Smbios
docs.text:
Smbios provides detailed information about the system's SMBios data, such as BIOS, board, chassis, memory, and processors.

Type JSON Smbios smbios,omitempty

docs.title: Swap
docs.text:
Swap contains a list of swap entries representing the system's swap devices or files and their respective details.

Type JSON []*ephem.SwapEntry swap,omitempty

docs.title: Scanner
docs.text: Scanner defines a type responsible for scanning and reporting system hardware information.

docs.title: Swap
docs.text:
Swap indicates whether the system swap information should be reported.

Type JSON bool ``

docs.title: Ephemeral
docs.text:
Ephemeral indicates whether the scanner should report ephemeral details, such as swap.

Type JSON bool ``

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
Features is a list of ProbeFeature types that should be scanned for.

Type JSON []hwinfo.ProbeFeature ``

docs.title: Smbios
docs.text: Smbios captures comprehensive information about the system's hardware components as reported by the System Management BIOS (SMBIOS).

docs.title: Bios
docs.text:
Bios provides detailed information about the system's BIOS, including vendor, version, date, features, and ROM size.

Type JSON *hwinfo.SmbiosBios bios,omitempty

docs.title: Board
docs.text:
Board holds motherboard information such as manufacturer, product, and version.

Type JSON *hwinfo.SmbiosBoard board,omitempty

docs.title: Cache
docs.text:
Cache provides details about the system's cache components.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios cache,omitempty

docs.title: Chassis
docs.text:
Chassis holds information related to the system's chassis, including manufacturer, version, and lock presence.

Type JSON *hwinfo.SmbiosChassis chassis,omitempty

docs.title: Config
docs.text:
Config captures system configuration options.

Type JSON *hwinfo.SmbiosConfig config,omitempty

docs.title: GroupAssociations
docs.text:
GroupAssociations lists associations between different hardware groups in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios group_associations,omitempty

docs.title: HardwareSecurity
docs.text:
HardwareSecurity provides information on the system's hardware security configurations.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios hardware_security,omitempty

docs.title: Language
docs.text:
Language contains language-related information, including supported and current languages.

Type JSON *hwinfo.SmbiosLanguage language,omitempty

docs.title: Memory64Error
docs.text:
Memory64Error provides information on 64-bit memory errors.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios memory_64_error,omitempty

docs.title: MemoryArray
docs.text:
MemoryArray details the physical memory arrays present in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios memory_array,omitempty

docs.title: MemoryArrayMappedAddress
docs.text:
MemoryArrayMappedAddress provides the mapped addresses of memory arrays.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios memory_array_mapped_address,omitempty

docs.title: MemoryDevice
docs.text:
MemoryDevice captures information about individual memory devices in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios memory_device,omitempty

docs.title: MemoryDeviceMappedAddress
docs.text:
MemoryDeviceMappedAddress provides the mapped addresses of memory devices.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios memory_device_mapped_address,omitempty

docs.title: MemoryError
docs.text:
MemoryError provides information on memory errors detected in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios memory_error,omitempty

docs.title: Onboard
docs.text:
Onboard lists the onboard devices present in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios onboard,omitempty

docs.title: PointingDevice
docs.text:
PointingDevice details the system's pointing devices.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios pointing_device,omitempty

docs.title: PortConnector
docs.text:
PortConnector lists the port connectors present on the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios port_connector,omitempty

docs.title: PowerControls
docs.text:
PowerControls provides information on the power control mechanisms in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios power_controls,omitempty

docs.title: Processor
docs.text:
Processor captures details about the processors used in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios processor,omitempty

docs.title: Slot
docs.text:
Slot lists the expansion slots available in the system.

Type JSON []hwinfo.Smbios slot,omitempty

docs.title: System
docs.text:
System captures overall system-related information such as manufacturer, product, version, and UUID.

Type JSON *hwinfo.SmbiosSystem system,omitempty

docs.title: PnP
docs.text:
todo par and ser ports

Type JSON bool pnp

docs.title: Command
docs.text:
todo map pci constants from pci.h?

Type JSON uint command

docs.title: ProgIf
docs.text:
Programming Interface Byte: a read-only register that specifies a register-level programming interface for the device.

Type JSON uint prog_if

docs.title: Bus
docs.text:
already included in the parent model, so we omit from JSON output

Type JSON uint -

docs.title: Data
docs.text:
Omit from JSON output

Type JSON string -

docs.title: Vendor
docs.text:
already included in the parent model, so we omit from JSON output

Type JSON uint -

docs.title: RawDescriptor
docs.text:
Seems empty and not really needed, omit for now

Type JSON MemoryRange -

docs.title: Serial
docs.text:
Sensitive, omit from JSON output

Type JSON string -

docs.title: DeviceNumber
docs.text: DeviceNumber represents a Unix device number, a unique identifier for devices in the system.

docs.title: Type
docs.text:
Type indicates if the device is a character or a block device.

Type JSON int type

docs.title: Major
docs.text:
Major identifies the driver for a device.

Type JSON uint major

docs.title: Minor
docs.text:
Minor is used by the device driver to distinguish between different devices it controls, or different instances of the same device.

Type JSON uint minor

docs.title: HardwareDevice
docs.text: HardwareDevice represents a hardware component detected in the system.

docs.title: Class
docs.text:
Class represents the type of the hardware component.

Type JSON HardwareClass -

docs.title: Index
docs.text:
Index is a unique index provided by hwinfo, starting at 1

Type JSON uint -

docs.title: BusType
docs.text:
BusType represents the type of bus to which the hardware device is connected.

Type JSON *Id bus_type,omitempty

docs.title: Slot
docs.text:
Slot represents a bus and slot number for the hardware device.

Type JSON *Slot slot,omitempty

docs.title: BaseClass
docs.text:
BaseClass specifies the base classification of the hardware device.

Type JSON *Id base_class,omitempty

docs.title: SubClass
docs.text:
SubClass represents the specific subclass of the hardware component, providing more granular identification within its class.

Type JSON *Id sub_class,omitempty

docs.title: PciInterface
docs.text:
PciInterface specifies the PCI interface identifier of the hardware device.

Type JSON *Id pci_interface,omitempty

docs.title: Vendor
docs.text:
Vendor represents the vendor ID of the hardware device.

Type JSON *Id vendor,omitempty

docs.title: SubVendor
docs.text:
SubVendor represents the ID of the subsystem vendor.

Type JSON *Id sub_vendor,omitempty

docs.title: Device
docs.text:
Device represents the unique identifier for the hardware device.

Type JSON *Id device,omitempty

docs.title: SubDevice
docs.text:
SubDevice represents the identifier of a sub-device in the hardware

Type JSON *Id sub_device,omitempty

docs.title: Revision
docs.text:
Revision specifies the hardware revision identifier.

Type JSON *Id revision,omitempty

docs.title: CompatVendor
docs.text:
CompatVendor is a vendor id and name of some compatible hardware. Used mainly for ISA-PnP devices.

Type JSON *Id compat_vendor,omitempty

docs.title: CompatDevice
docs.text:
CompatDevice is a device id and name of some compatible hardware. Used mainly for ISA-PnP devices.

Type JSON *Id compat_device,omitempty

docs.title: Model
docs.text:
Model is a combination of vendor and device names. Some heuristics are used to make it more presentable.

Type JSON string model,omitempty

docs.title: SysfsId
docs.text:
SysfsId is a sysfs entry for this hardware, if any.

Type JSON string sysfs_id,omitempty

docs.title: SysfsBusId
docs.text:
SysfsBusId is a sysfs bus entry for this hardware, if any.

Type JSON string sysfs_bus_id,omitempty

docs.title: SysfsDeviceLink
docs.text:
SysfsDeviceLink is the string path to the system file system (sysfs) link for this hardware device.

Type JSON string sysfs_device_link,omitempty

docs.title: SysfsIOMMUGroupId
docs.text:
SysfsIOMMUGroupId represents the IOMMU group ID associated with the hardware device in sysfs, if any.

Type JSON *IOMMUGroup sysfs_iommu_group_id,omitempty

docs.title: UnixDeviceName
docs.text:
UnixDeviceName is a path to a device file used to access this hardware. Normally something below /dev. For network interfaces, this is the interface name.

Type JSON string unix_device_name,omitempty

docs.title: UnixDeviceNumber
docs.text:
UnixDeviceNumber represents the device type and number according to sysfs.

Type JSON *DeviceNumber unix_device_number,omitempty

docs.title: UnixDeviceNames
docs.text:
UnixDeviceNames is a list of device names which can be used to access this hardware. Normally something below /dev. They should all be equivalent. The preferred name is UnixDeviceName.

Type JSON []string unix_device_names,omitempty

docs.title: UnixDeviceName2
docs.text:
UnixDeviceName2 is a path to a device file used to access this hardware. Most hardware only has one device name, stored in UnixDeviceName. In some cases, there's an alternative name.

Type JSON string unix_device_name2,omitempty

docs.title: UnixDeviceNumber2
docs.text:
UnixDeviceNumber2 is an alternative device type and number according to sysfs.

Type JSON *DeviceNumber unix_device_number2,omitempty

docs.title: RomId
docs.text:
RomId represents a BIOS/PROM id. Where appropriate, this is a special BIOS/PROM id (e.g. "0x80" for the first harddisk on Intel-PCs). CHPID for s390.

Type JSON string rom_id,omitempty

docs.title: Udi
docs.text:
Udi is a HAL unique device identifier.

Type JSON string udi,omitempty

docs.title: ParentUdi
docs.text:
ParentUdi is the udi of a parent device, if any.

Type JSON string parent_udi,omitempty

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Resources is a list of device resources.

Type JSON []Resource resources,omitempty

docs.title: Detail
docs.text:
Detail is specific information associated with this hardware.

Type JSON Detail detail,omitempty

docs.title: Hotplug
docs.text:
Hotplug indicates the type of hotplug controller associated with this device, if any.

Type JSON *Hotplug hotplug,omitempty

docs.title: HotplugSlot
docs.text:
HotplugSlot indicates the slot this device is connected to, if any (e.g. PCMCIA socket). Counts are 1-based.

Type JSON uint hotplug_slot,omitempty

docs.title: Driver
docs.text:
Driver is the currently active driver, if any.

Type JSON string driver,omitempty

docs.title: DriverModule
docs.text:
DriverModule is the currently active driver module, if any.

Type JSON string driver_module,omitempty

docs.title: Drivers
docs.text:
Drivers is a list of currently active drivers.

Type JSON []string drivers,omitempty

docs.title: DriverModules
docs.text:
DriverModules is a list of currently active driver modules.

Type JSON []string driver_modules,omitempty

docs.title: DriverInfo
docs.text:
DriverInfo is available driver information for the currently active driver, if any.

Type JSON DriverInfo driver_info,omitempty

docs.title: UsbGuid
docs.text:
UsbGuid is a USB Global Unique Identifier. Available for USB devices. This may be set even if the bus type is not USB (e.g. USB storage devices will have bus set to SCSI due to SCSI emulation)

Type JSON string usb_guid,omitempty

docs.title: ModuleAlias
docs.text:
ModuleAlias for matching and loading kernel modules for this hardware.

Type JSON string module_alias,omitempty

docs.title: Label
docs.text:
Label is a Consistent Device Name (CDN), as per PCI firmware spec 3.1, chapter 4.6.7

Type JSON string label,omitempty

docs.title: SmbiosMemoryArray
docs.text: SmbiosMemoryArray captures physical memory array information (consists of several memory devices).

docs.title: SmbiosMemoryArrayMappedAddress
docs.text: SmbiosMemoryArrayMappedAddress captures physical memory array information (consists of several memory devices).

docs.title: SmbiosMemoryDeviceMappedAddress
docs.text: SmbiosMemoryDeviceMappedAddress captures physical memory array information (consists of several memory devices).
